entries.title: Android Studio Electric Eel
entries.description: This release includes updates and new features that cover across design, build & dependencies, emulators & devices, and IntelliJ.

entries.title: Announcing .NET Community Toolkit 8.1! Better, faster MVVM source generators, .NET 7 support, and more!
entries.description: It takes a village to raise a toolkit

entries.title: Building an Audio Recorder and Player App in .NET MAUI
entries.description: In this blog, you will learn how to develop an audio recorder and player in .NET MAUI. The audio player will record and play audio files.

entries.title: Introducing Trapeze: Easy iOS and Android Project Configuration
entries.description: I’m excited to announce the public availability of Trapeze, our new open-source project that makes it easy to manage native and cross-platform mobile projects from a simple YAML-based configuration-file format.

entries.title: Material 3 for Flutter
entries.description: In this article, I’ll show you the new features in Material 3, how to integrate them into your Flutter app, and update you on what’s coming next.

entries.title: Microsoft: Windows 11 apps might not start after system restore
Microsoft’s HoloLens hardware team is on the chopping block amid mass layoffs
Pass the design baton with Relay
entries.description: The goal of Relay is to simplify the “handoff problem” between designers and developers by translating Figma designs directly into Compose code.

entries.title: Scientists are getting eerily good at using WiFi to 'see' people through walls in detail
entries.description: It even works better than those X-Ray Spex I got in the mail

entries.title: Swift will get a new Foundation framework with ‘no more wrapped C code’
entries.description: Apple’s Swift language will get a new open source Foundation framework – used in almost all Swift projects – that will be native Swift, rather than wrapping Objective-C as it does currently.

entries.title: The State of Mobile User Experience
entries.description: Fifteen years from the original iPhone, the quality of mobile user experience has stabilized. Mobile standards have emerged and the lines between the mobile web and native apps are becoming blurrier.

entries.title: Visual Studio 2022 17.5 Preview 3 is here!
entries.description: Download it while it's still warm!
